availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eli J. Fleming (Bath County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Maranda Tackett Fleming in Bath County, Kentucky, on April 5, 1853. Father of George W. Fleming, Susan Fleming, Thomas J. Fleming, and John Fleming. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Colonel of the Bath County Enrolled Militia in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 85.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273007, p. 315.
“Annual Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky,” in 1864 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 2. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), 231.
